item.title: Official Google Blog: An update on Google Health and Google PowerMeter
item.description: An update on Google Health and Google PowerMeter http://ff.im/-Gx3i2
item.content:encoded: An update on Google Health and Google PowerMeter http://ff.im/-Gx3i2 In the coming months, we’re going to retire two products that didn’t catch on the way we would have hoped, but did serve as influential models: Google Health (retiring January 1, 2012; data available for download through January 1, 2013) and Google PowerMeter (retiring September 16, 2011). Both were based on the idea that with more and better information, people can make smarter choices, whether in regard to managing personal health and wellness, or saving money and conserving energy at home. While they didn't scale as we had hoped, we believe they did highlight the importance of access to information in areas where it’s traditionally been difficult. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: googleblog.blogspot.com

item.title: In-Stream Ads Are Coming To Twitter, Will A User Revolt Follow?
item.description: In-Stream Ads Are Coming To Twitter, Will A User Revolt Follow? http://tcrn.ch/k1Fguz by @alexia
item.content:encoded: In-Stream Ads Are Coming To Twitter, Will A User Revolt Follow? http://tcrn.ch/k1Fguz by @alexia After nine months of testing in-stream Promoted Tweets on third party client Hootsuite, reports have surfaced today that Twitter's head of monetization Adam Bain has been pushing a new in-timeline Promoted Tweets product during this week's advertiser-heavy Canne Lions awards. To the two of you that this comes to as a shock, one word: Inevitable. Twitter has made no secret of the fact that in-stream Promoted Tweets have been an eventual business model goal since April of 2010, when co-founder Biz Stone outlined a plan to launch them first on search on Twitter.com, later in 3rd party search and eventually in the user timeline. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: techcrunch.com

item.content:encoded: OMG, this is crazy ... http://bit.ly/lCspls As mourning relatives filed past her open coffin in Kazan, Russia, the supposedly dead woman suddenly woke up and started screaming., As mourning relatives filed past her open coffin in Kazan, Russia, the supposedly dead woman suddenly woke up and started screaming. item.dc:creator: dailymail.co.uk

item.title: Facebook Now Has 750 Million Users
item.description: Source: Facebook Now Has 750 Million Users http://tcrn.ch/l92xEI by @jasonkincaid
item.content:encoded: Source: Facebook Now Has 750 Million Users http://tcrn.ch/l92xEI by @jasonkincaid Facebook's incredible worldwide growth has reached another major milestone: the service now has 750 million monthly active users, according to a source close to the company. We reached out to Facebook for confirmation, and a company spokesperson responded that they don't have anything to announce at this time. That isn't surprising: the company hasn't officially released an updated user count since it reached 500 million users nearly a year ago. Facebook has obviously been growing since then — we believe the company may be waiting until it hits the 1 billion mark before officially updating the stat again. The last semi-official update came from a leaked Goldman Sachs report for potential Facebook investors that pegged the number at 600 million in January. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: techcrunch.com

item.title: PayPal Seeing $10M In Mobile Payments Per Day; Will Hit $3B Total In 2011
item.description: PayPal Seeing $10M In Mobile Payments Per Day; Will Hit $3B Total In 2011 http://tcrn.ch/kIxm0y by @leenarao
item.content:encoded: PayPal Seeing $10M In Mobile Payments Per Day; Will Hit $3B Total In 2011 http://tcrn.ch/kIxm0y by @leenarao PayPal is upping its estimates of the amount of mobile payments transactions using the technology this year; doubling the estimate to $3 billion in mobile total payments volume (TPV) in 2011. PayPal says that the rate at which people are using the payments technology to buy items via their mobile phones is growing rapidly and this is actually the third time the company has had to update its numbers. At years end in 2010, PayPal predicted $1.5 billion in mobile payments and in February, the company revised this to $2 billion. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: techcrunch.com

item.content:encoded: Five Reasons Domains Are Getting Less Important: http://bit.ly/msJvTp While discussing possible names for a product recently, someone asked me if we were at the point where getting the perfect domain name was less important than it used to be. While I'm still a sucker for a clean .com, it does seem less important, and it will continue to become less important, for at least five reasons: Link - Trackbacks

item.title: Oblong Has Built The Future Of Computing. I’ve Seen It. Used It. It’s Beautiful.
item.description: Oblong Has Built The Future Of Computing. I've Seen It. Used It. It's Beautiful. http://tcrn.ch/iEtXnf by @parislemon
item.content:encoded: Oblong Has Built The Future Of Computing. I've Seen It. Used It. It's Beautiful. http://tcrn.ch/iEtXnf by @parislemon Over the past several years, I’ve followed pretty much every new thing in the technology space, and written about many of them. But it’s hard not to get cynical when so much of what’s out there is not only not revolutionary, it’s often not even evolutionary. Instead, much of what I see is simply derivative and quite frankly, boring. But every once in a while something crops up that is truly game-changing. And it restores my faith in technology. That’s the best way to describe what I saw when I met with Oblong Industries this week. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: techcrunch.com

item.title: Report: O.J. Simpson Confesses to Murder of Ex-Wife Nicole Brown Simpson - NESN Newswire - NESN.com
item.description: Report: O.J. Simpson Confesses to Murder of Ex-Wife Nicole Brown Simpson http://bit.ly/kVI9Tu
item.content:encoded: Report: O.J. Simpson Confesses to Murder of Ex-Wife Nicole Brown Simpson http://bit.ly/kVI9Tu O.J. Simpson has reportedly admitted to the murder of Nicole Brown Simpson in 1994. Simpson confessed to a producer for Oprah Winfrey, and he will reportedly repeat the confession to Winfrey during a televised interview. Several news outlets are citing the National Enquirer with breaking the news. The initial interview took place in prison, where Simpson is serving a nine-year sentence for kidnapping and robbery. Simpson claimed he stabbed Nicole in self-defense. The former NFL running back and part-time movie star was acquitted after being charged for the murders of his ex-wife and Ron Goldman. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: nesn.com

item.title: After Seven Years, The Winklevosses Drop Battle With Facebook [Update: They're Back]
item.description: After Seven Years, The Winklevosses Give Up On Battle With Facebook http://tcrn.ch/jQg9sK by @alexia
item.content:encoded: After Seven Years, The Winklevosses Give Up On Battle With Facebook http://tcrn.ch/jQg9sK by @alexia After seven years of lawsuits! ... After reaching a $65 million dollar settlement with Facebook in 2008 which they then tried to rescind on the argument that Facebook gave them misleading information! ... After vowing that they would challenge an April 2011 ruling by the 9th Circuit Court and take their case all the way to the Supreme Court, (!) the Winklevosses have just given up on their fight against Facebook. In a statement made to the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit in San Francisco today, the twins and friend Divya Narendra said that they have dropped the legal appeal of the most recent court ruling (in favor of Facebook) after Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: techcrunch.com
